questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of encapsulation in object-oriented programming?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To reduce code duplication", "B": "To hide internal implementation details from external interfaces", "C": "To improve performance by reducing memory usage", "D": "To simplify debugging"}
questions.explanation: Encapsulation is used to hide the internal implementation details of an object from its external interfaces, promoting data hiding and abstraction.

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of encapsulation in object-oriented programming?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To improve code readability by hiding implementation details.", "B": "To increase modularity and reusability of code.", "C": "To reduce coupling between classes and objects.", "D": "None of the above."}
questions.explanation: Encapsulation reduces coupling by hiding internal implementation details, making it easier to modify or replace individual components without affecting other parts of the system.

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of an abstract class in C++?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To provide a common interface for related classes", "B": "To declare a class that cannot be instantiated directly", "C": "To define a class with both data and methods", "D": "To inherit properties from a base class"}
questions.explanation: An abstract class in C++ is declared as 'abstract' using the 'abstract' keyword, which prevents it from being instantiated directly. This allows for inheritance of its properties and methods by other classes.

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of using abstract classes in C++?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To provide a common interface for related classes", "B": "To enable runtime polymorphism through function overriding", "C": "To encapsulate data and behavior, promoting code reuse", "D": "To implement the Singleton design pattern"}
questions.explanation: Abstract classes in C++ provide a common interface for related classes, allowing for polymorphism and facilitating code reuse through inheritance.
